sections.heading: Tender and acceptance of less than the amount of the claimA compromise is also made when the claimant of a disputed or unliquidated claim, regardless of the extent of his claim, accepts a payment that the other party tenders with the clearly expressed written condition that acceptance of the payment
sections.text: Tender and acceptance of less than the amount of the claimA compromise is also made when the claimant of a disputed or unliquidated claim, regardless of the extent of his claim, accepts a payment that the other party tenders with the clearly expressed written condition that acceptance of the payment will extinguish the obligation.Acts 2007, No. 138, ยง1.
